topics.body:
"@MoogSourceVermona":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ac3b2263687202ff000278#post_55ac3b2263687202ff000278
It's has more Demolition Man influences than 1984 influences from what I've seen. Here's the backstory of the anime. Japan has pretty much gone FullCensorship, banning porn and even lewd words like penis or vagina. But the country at least has high moral ranking. If you forget the fact that you can get SWATTed just by looking at porn. And the fact that there's a politician who wants every person in the country to be monitored for every second of their life if her goal's reached.
topics.author: 554d477e63687270dee30600

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ac35236368725131000119#post_55ac35236368725131000119
I heard about that one a long time ago. However, I only ever actually saw bonus pages, that aren't very objectionable (well, several people would find them that, but they're really more darkly humorous than anything) and really don't show how fucked up that manga actually is.

I think I prefer to keep it that way.
topics.author: 5179b098a4c72d9b7f0028ee

topics.body:
"@MoogSourceVermona":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ac3c406368721c34000865#post_55ac3c406368721c34000865
Yeah, just imagine the "utopia" of Demolition Man, and you'd get a somewhat accurate depiction of Japan in that show. Also, the main character's father is considered a terrorist because he opposed this crazy shit, and the main character is ostracized by it, and is traumatized so much that he pretty much hates his father for doing what is essentially the right thing.
topics.author: 554d477e63687270dee30600
